verses.roman:
sakala-lokera ciḍā pūrṇa yabe ha-ila
dhyāne tabe prabhu mahāprabhure ānila

synonyms: sakala-lokera—of everyone; ciḍā—chipped rice; pūrṇa—full; yabe—when; ha-ila—was; dhyāne—in meditation; tabe—at that time; prabhu—Lord Nityānanda Prabhu; mahāprabhure ānila—brought Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu.
translation: When chipped rice had been served to everyone, Lord Nityānanda Prabhu, in meditation, brought Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu.
